How can a design toolbox enable box designers and consumers to make innovative, bespoke digital fashion fabric? #textiletoolbox
How can the multitude of small makers join forces to create new economic models for fashion? #textiletoolbox
How can the consumer extend the life of their garments - either at home, within a retail environment, or in a social space? #textiletoolbox
How can the use of laser technologies lead us to more localised production? #textiletoolbox
How can we make fast fashion genuinely faster, and ‘lighter’? #textiletoolbox
10 exhibits ask key questions around manufacturing & the culture of consumption required for a sustainable fashion industry #textiletoolbox:
The #textiletoolbox exhibition has emerged from the @mistrafashion + @TEDTextiles research, and launches this evening + online @ChelseaUAL
“They vary from asking questions on technology and processes of the future...” @rlearley #textiletoolbox
“…to how business models & consumer behaviours need to change.” @rlearley #textiletoolbox http://t.co/jF1idHvqV2
“The exhibits are ‘provotypes’, prototypes that provoke debate.” @rlearley #textiletoolbox
“Most of all we want the exhibits to provoke thought, then actions.” @rlearley #textiletoolbox
“Each exhibit will apply TED's ‘layered thinking’ & connect more than one of #TheTEN strategies in the outcome.” @rlearley #textiletoolbox
Headpiece+Shoes: @bhmakes inspired by kitchenware+ food, creating pieces that can be dismantled/recycled, composted/upcycled...

The next phase: bring consumer behaviour experts & real 'fashion library' users together #textiletoolbox http://t.co/C8t930i2We #WIP

Fast Refashion by Prof Becky Earley @rlearley: Service design as complimentary strategy for a sustainable fashion industry #textiletoolbox
